content.description:
Taksim Square climbs more clean faces with extraordinary holds.

Go up a corner's left face, stay left to turn a roof, then climb some more aesthetic moves to bolts under a roof (I think there's a 2 bolt anchor). From under this roof, move right past a crack then a rail to bolt and right some more to a ledge and the anchor to the last pitch. Go right to stand on holds at the lip of a roof, and move up on hold after hold of delightful climbing to the anchors.

From the 1st roof, one can traverse left to top of pillar and climb short face to ledge to traverse right to the last pitch belay.
content.location: From the trail at the base, go right to a corner with a smooth-ish left face. Follow bolts up.

content.description: Pick a hold, and climb superb features on this clean face.
content.location: It is the second route from the right.

content.description: Black Sea climbs a clean face left of a left-slanting, flared crack and then leads right to the anchors. Then move right on a sweet rail, do an easy move to a stance, and go over a bulge on nice holds to delicate face moves to an easy runout corner to the top of the cliff. It can be broken into two pitches, belaying at the end of the flared crack / clean face pitch.
content.location: Start left of where the trail reaches the cliff with a prominent, clean face and left-slanting, white, flared dihedral.
